Title: ML/AI Engineer
Description:
Your mission

As an ML/AI Engineer at Astrafy, you will work on various projects to help our customers build, deploy, and scale ML/AI models in production. You will collaborate closely with both technical and business teams to create tailored ML/AI solutions.

On The Business Side


Engage with stakeholders to understand the business objectives and identify ML/AI opportunities.
Analyze available data sources to assess feasibility and design model deployment strategies.
Define and align project goals with measurable KPIs.


On The Technical Side


Design and develop machine learning models using PyTorch, TensorFlow and other frameworks.
Implement MLOps practices to automate the training and deployment and monitoring of models using tools like Kubeflow
Build scalable pipelines for model training, testing, and deployment.
Ensure that models are fully automated, from data preprocessing to production deployment.
Collaborate with data engineers and other stakeholders to optimize model performance.


In addition to these responsibilities, Astrafy values knowledge sharing and thought leadership. We actively contribute to platforms like Medium and LinkedIn, publishing articles and sharing insights to grow our community and industry presence.

You will be encouraged to contribute by writing articles that enhance Astrafy‚Äôs impact and foster collaboration across the industry.

Your profile


Proficiency in machine learning algorithms, model development, and deployment
Strong understanding of MLOps practices for automating the full model lifecycle
Experience with Google Cloud, particularly Vertex AI and BigQuery
Experience working on solutions using LLMs especially in Retrieval Augmented Generation
Strong programming skills in Python and frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Familiarity with data preprocessing, model tuning, and performance optimization
Attention to detail and quality with excellent problem-solving
You have an analytics and solution-oriented mindset
You work well in a team as well as independently
Excellent communication and collaboration skills (both with your colleagues as well as with external stakeholders)
You are fluent in English; knowledge of French or Spanish is a plus
Ability to work independently and in teams, with excellent problem-solving and communication skills
Experience with LangChain, LangGraph, dbt is a plus
You must be eligible to work in Europe


This role is not just a job; it's an opportunity to be at the forefront of the data revolution, helping companies unlock the potential of ML/AI technologies. If you are passionate about ML/AI, thrive in dynamic environments, and are eager to make a significant impact, we would love to hear from you.

Was this list a bit much? Don't worry - we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning.

Why us?


An attractive salary package, with no blurry or hidden clauses. Everything we offer is open-source via our Gitbook. Check it out here (https://astrafy.gitbook.io/handbook/its-all-about-people/compensation).
An exciting job where technology innovation is not a buzzword but a reality.

Flexible working hours and remote policies. Check it out here (https://docs.astrafy.io/handbook/the-company/remote-work).
An excellent team of colleagues & regular team-building activities. Check it out here (https://docs.astrafy.io/handbook/its-all-about-people/team-building-and-retreat).


And much more. We have compiled a detailed handbook covering all you need to know about our company. Check it out here (https://docs.astrafy.io/handbook/).

Our mission is to help companies and individuals solve data analytics problems by covering the full spectrum of the data journey (from ingestion, transformation and finally distribution of data to downstream applications) with a Modern Data Stack. Building the most powerful and easy to use digital Wallet in the world.

Power Solutions & Vestas Quality > Aerodynamic & Mechanical > NVH & Verification

Support and facilitate utilization and connection methods and results across the Powertrain area


Qualifications


Master's degree in Mathematics, Mechanical Engineering, Computational Science, or similar
Familiar with rotating machinery (gears, bearings, etc) from Wind Turbine, Aerospace or Heavy Industries.- Experience with scripting (Python, MATLAB, or similar) and version control (git, or similar)
Experience working with databases and different data structures
Fluent in English (written and spoken)
Ability to work in a complex and varied environment


Competencies


Your analytical skills in combination with your university education enable you to focus your activities for finding the optimum technical solution within the given boundaries
Thanks to your pro-active and motivated personality, you achieve your results by setting the direction, defining and setting task precedence and making sure that necessary conclusion can be taken
With your structured and organized way of working you plan and prioritize the tasks while at the same time keeping focus on the overall targets
Your organizational and communicative skills allow you to achieve your results through international and multi-disciplinary teams which involve colleagues from various parts of Vestas


What We Offer

We offer you a creative position with excellent professional and personal development opportunities in an inspiring, international work environment at an established manufacturer of wind turbines.

Additional Information

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. To apply for this opportunity please submit your resume in English.

Vestas is the energy industry‚Äôs global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. Title: Software Engineer (Safety)
Description:
Do you want to shape the future of green energy?




Vestas Technology & Operations > Research & Development (R&D) > Safety

The Safety department is responsible for ensuring the complete end-to-end design of safety-critical software functions. Based on system-level functional safety requirements from stakeholders, we identify the safety software functions needed as well as any supporting control functions, determine the architecture required to support this, design the software requirements according to the safety integrity level required, perform the implementation, perform testing at multiple levels including hardware-in-the-loop and in wind turbine prototypes, and provide diagnostics and field support to service personnel. We implement and test safety-critical software in the ANSYS SCADE environment, and control functionality in MATLAB Simulink and C++.

The department consists of 20+ people, in multiple teams, possessing a broad range of competencies within functional safety, product knowledge, software development and other areas. Daily work is performed in scrum teams, and we work with a continuous improvement mindset focusing on automation of work processes.




Responsibilities

As a Safety Software Engineer in our department, you will be responsible for leading the development of specific features within safety-critical software and the accompanying control software for safety-related functions in Vestas products, which span a variety of different wind turbine models. You will primarily utilize ANSYS SCADE for safety-critical software implementation and testing, as well as some MATLAB Simulink and C++ for control software. This work includes, but is not limited to, the following activities:

Guiding and driving the development of software for specific safety functions, from requirements to fully tested deliverables, according to functional safety processes
Analysis and breakdown of system requirements into software requirements
Design and implementation of software for distributed control systems primarily using ANSYS SCADE for safety-critical functions, with some use of Simulink and C++ for other control, support and diagnostic functions
Software test in various environments, including PC-based simulators, hardware-in-the-loop test rigs, and actual wind turbines
Debugging and support of field issues found in software by our service technicians
Generation of documentation artifacts
Development and maintenance of the software development setup and the software tool chain




Qualifications

M.Sc. or PhD in control engineering, software engineering, electronics engineering, or similar education
3+ years of industry experience in safety-critical software engineering, including practical experience in applying safety software development practices and use of the ANSYS SCADE environment
3+ years of industry experience in embedded software development
Experience with scripting and software development tool chains
Experience with MATLAB Simulink is beneficial
It's also a positive feature if you are acquainted with electrical and hydraulic systems




Competencies

You have good communication skills and are fluent in English (written and spoken)
You are comfortable interacting, supporting and managing different internal stakeholders
You have a structured approach to daily work and have an eye for detail
You are willing to share results and challenges openly and work toward your own development
You leverage your technical experience to guide others in your team




What We Offer

We offer an opportunity to be part of a world-class company in an exciting business with a very comprehensive product range. You will be part of a project-oriented team with very competent colleagues in an inspiring work environment. You will be part of an international organization, having opportunities to grow and develop on the job, both professionally and personally.




Additional Information

We will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis, therefore, early applications are encouraged. To apply for this opportunity please submit your CV in English.
